author: Greg Stohr
description: President Donald Trump asked the US Supreme Court to let him fire the only remaining Democrat on the Federal Trade Commission, teeing up a case that could overturn a 90-year-old precedent and give the White House tighter control over federal regulators.
title: Trump Asks Supreme Court to Let Him Fire FTC Commissioner

author: Benoit Berthelot
description: French Prime Minister Francois Bayrou said he doesn’t regret calling a confidence vote putting his government on the line, as France is “burdened with debt” and the political parties must “each take responsibility.”
title: France’s Bayrou Defends Confidence Vote as Needed Wake-Up Call

author: Erik Larson
description: New York Attorney General Letitia James is asking the state’s highest court to reinstate a nearly half-billion dollar fraud penalty against President Donald Trump and his company in a civil fraud lawsuit after an intermediate appeals court tossed out the massive fine.
title: NY Appealing Dismissal of Trump’s $464 Million Fraud Penalty

author: Kamailoudini Tagba
description: Mali has taken Algeria to the International Court of Justice as it accuses the north African country of downing one of its military drones in April.
title: Mali Takes Algeria to ICJ for Downing Its Military Drone

author: Chris Dolmetsch, Michelle Ma
description: The US asked a federal court to force Southern California Edison to pay for fighting a pair of wildfires that were believed to have originated from its power lines, including the Eaton Fire in January in Los Angeles County that killed more than a dozen people and destroyed thousands of structures.
title: Southern California Edison Should Pay for LA Fire Costs, US Says

author: Stephan Kueffner, Eric Martin
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said the US would be open to basing troops in Ecuador more than 15 years after a previous president asked American forces to leave.
title: Rubio Says US Is Open to Basing Troops in Ecuador as Ties Warm

author: Janet Lorin, Liam Knox
description: Northwestern University President Michael Schill resigned after a three-year tenure marked by controversy following protests on campus, conflict with the Trump administration over research funding and a hazing scandal in its football program.
title: Northwestern President Resigns as School Battles White House

author: Brian Platt
description: Canada and the US agreed to hold technical talks on sectoral tariffs after officials met with Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick last week, said Canadian cabinet minister Dominic LeBlanc.
title: Canada, US Holding ‘Technical’ Talks on Sectoral Tariffs, Minister Says

author: Erik Larson
description: The US Justice Department made fresh arguments about why President Donald Trump should be allowed to oust Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook over alleged mortgage fraud while she challenges her removal, saying her claim that her termination is a pretext to lower interest rates is “baseless.”
title: Trump Makes Fresh Plea for Ruling Allowing Him to Oust Lisa Cook

author: Josh Sisco, Leah Nylen
description: The US Federal Trade Commission plans to study the harms to children and others of AI-powered chatbots like those offered by OpenAI, Alphabet Inc.’s Google and Meta Platforms Inc., according to people familiar with the matter.
title: FTC to Review AI Chatbot Risks With Focus on Privacy Harms

author: Alex Wickham
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said he would “act on” the outcome of an independent investigation into his deputy Angela Rayner’s tax affairs, signaling he would fire her if the inquiry found she had breached rules governing ministers’ behavior.
title: UK’s Starmer Vows to ‘Act on’ Inquiry Into Deputy’s Tax Affairs

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: Latin American nations are preparing a joint declaration expressing concern over rising tension between the US and Venezuela, according to Chile’s top diplomat.
title: Latin American Nations to Decry US-Venezuela Tension, Chile Says

author: Brendan Scott
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer said he hopes the UK’s £10 billion ($13 billion) shipbuilding deal with Norway will be the “first of many” such defense contracts, touting similar talks with countries including Denmark, Sweden and Turkey.
title: Starmer Eyes UK Ship Deals With Denmark, Sweden After Norway Win

author: James Attwood, Matthew Malinowski, Valentina Fuentes
description: The candidate most likely to be Chile’s next president would do a thorough review of struggling state copper behemoth Codelco to determine what’s needed to ensure its financial viability.
title: Leading Chile Candidate to Scrutinize Codelco as Debt Mounts

author: Catarina Saraiva
description: President Donald Trump’s pick to fill a vacant seat on the Federal Reserve’s Board reiterated his commitment to central bank independence at a confirmation hearing Thursday, pushing back on concerns from Democrats that he would merely do Trump’s bidding.
title: Trump’s Fed Pick Lauds Importance of Independence at Hearing

author: Zoe Tillman
description: Washington officials have sued President Donald Trump over his deployment of thousands of National Guard troops to the nation’s capital, escalating local opposition to the administration’s moves to exert more control over the city’s day-to-day affairs.
title: Trump Sued Over Washington National Guard Troop Deployment

author: Samy Adghirni
description: French President Emmanuel Macron said 26 countries had pledged to provide Ukraine with security guarantees in the event of a ceasefire with Donald Trump stopping short of committing to US backstop.
title: Macron Says 26 Nations to Back Security Guarantees for Ukraine

author: Josh Wingrove, Chris Strohm
description: The US Justice Department opened a criminal investigation into whether Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook committed mortgage fraud — ratcheting up pressure in President Donald Trump’s bid to oust her from the central bank.
title: Justice Department Probing Lisa Cook for Mortgage Fraud

author: Andrea Dudik
description: Czech billionaire Andrej Babis pledged to lower taxes, raise pensions and keep the country out of the euro area among his main priorities if he returns to power after October elections.
title: Czech Election Favorite Vows Tax Cuts and No to Euro If in Power

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: The Pentagon’s inspector general has initiated a review of how US military personnel in Japan complied with policies on preventing and addressing violent crimes after reports of sexual assaults in the country.
title: Pentagon’s Inspector General Starts Review of Crimes in Japan

author: Maria Eloisa Capurro
description: Use of artificial intelligence among businesses jumped in the last year and is expected to continue to grow, yet few firms have cut jobs as a result so far, according to a new Federal Reserve Bank of New York study.
title: NY Fed Finds Modest Impact of AI on Jobs Even as Usage Increases

author: Patrick Gillespie
description: Argentine President Javier Milei will sit down with billionaire Michael Milken in Los Angeles just days before his government faces its biggest electoral test since taking office almost two years ago.
title: Milei Jets Up to Hollywood to Meet Milken Before Crucial Vote

author: Ike Swetlitz
description: Pharmacies in Massachusetts can now administer the new Covid shots after the state changed its policy to gain more independence from a federal government that is moving to restrict the availability of vaccines.
title: Massachusetts Allows Pharmacies to Give New Covid Vaccines

author: Colum Murphy
description: Slovakia’s Prime Minister Robert Fico used a meeting with Xi Jinping to praise the Chinese leader’s massive military parade, describing the absence of other European Union leaders as a missed opportunity for dialogue with Beijing.
title: Slovak Leader Lauds Xi’s ‘Impressive’ Parade in Snub to Europe

description: Secretary of HHS Robert F. Kennedy Jr. arrives for a Senate Finance Committee hearing in Washington on Sept. 4.
title: RFK Jr. to Testify Before Senate Panel With Health Policy in Focus

description: Chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers and US Federal Reserve governor nominee for US President Donald Trump Stephen Miran arrives for a Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs Committee confirmation hearing in Washington on Sept. 4.
title: Trump’s Fed Pick Miran Faces Senators at Confirmation Hearing

author: Erik Larson
description: Embattled Orsted A/S sued the Trump administration in an effort to revive construction of its almost-finished offshore New England wind farm that the government blocked, kicking off what may become a major legal battle over recent policies targeting the industry.
title: Orsted Sues US in Bid to Salvage Wind Farm Blocked by Trump

author: Foster Wong
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping held talks with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un in Beijing on Thursday, according to the state-run Xinhua News Agency, marking their first bilateral meeting in around six years.
title: China’s Xi Holds Talks With North Korea’s Kim Jong Un in Beijing

author: Stephan Kueffner
description: Ecuador’s fiscally constrained government is getting outgunned and outmatched by ruthless cash-rich gangs vying for drug-trafficking territory. President Daniel Noboa is hoping a visit by US Secretary of State Marco Rubio will help him wage a turnaround in his security strategy.
title: Ecuador Floats US Deal to Accept Deportees for Security Aid

author: Zoe Tillman
description: The US judge in Boston who blocked the Trump administration from cutting off billions in federal research funding from Harvard University had a message for Justice Neil Gorsuch: Back off.
title: Harvard Judge Blasts Justice Gorsuch’s ‘Unhelpful’ Criticism

author: Samy Adghirni
description: French President Emmanuel Macron will seek to avoid calling a snap election if his prime minister is brought down in a confidence motion next week, according to people familiar with his thinking.
title: Macron Aims to Avoid Fresh Election If Prime Minister Falls

author: Ellen Milligan
description: NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte warned that Russia and China are preparing their defense industries for “long-term confrontation,” after Presidents Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin led a parade of Beijing’s new military hardware.
title: NATO Chief Warns China and Russia Are Preparing for ‘Long-Term Confrontation’

author: Jessica Nix, Steven T. Dennis
description: US Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. will confront bipartisan resistance to his moves to dismantle vaccine policies at a Senate hearing Thursday. But even as some Republicans openly defy the Trump administration’s leading spokesman on health issues, they’re still wary of risking the wrath of President Donald Trump.
title: RFK Jr. Will Face Skeptical Senators Who Walk Fine Lines

author: Simon Marks, Mohammed Alamin
description: A United Arab Emirates ban on all trade with Sudan has badly impacted the North African nation’s gold exports, spurring it to seek alternative buyers in Oman and elsewhere.
title: UAE Ban on Sudan Trade Spurs Hunt for Alternative Gold Markets

author: Alan Crawford
description: Investment vehicle has become a lightning rod for political tensions ahead of Monday’s election
title: Norway’s Election Is Suddenly a Global Matter

author: S'thembile Cele
description: South Africa’s finance minister favors Johnstone Makhubu to take over as commissioner of the nation’s tax agency, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: South Africa Finance Minister Tips Tax Agency Deputy as New Head

author: Nguyen Xuan Quynh
description: Vietnam’s government is establishing a fund to receive and manage donations to support the military and its diplomatic activities, a rare move announced just days after the nation held a grand parade in the capital.
title: Vietnam Opens Fund for Public Donations to Support Armed Forces

author: Martha Viotti Beck, Matheus Piovesana
description: Banco do Brasil, where sanctioned Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes has an account, is considering contingency plans if the US Treasury Department levies additional financial sanctions on its clients or on the bank itself, according to people familiar with the high-level internal discussions.
title: Banco do Brasil Mulls Range of Options If US Escalates Sanctions

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: India and Singapore pledged Thursday to deepen cooperation on artificial intelligence and semiconductors, signing new industry pacts as New Delhi works to expand trade ties with key partners and blunt the impact of 50% US tariffs.
title: India and Singapore Deepen AI, Chips Ties as US Tariff Risks Grow

author: James Hirai
description: France’s first bond sales since Prime Minister Francois Bayrou called for a confidence vote will test investor appetite for the second-highest yields in the euro area and the prospect of heightened political risk.
title: French Debt Sales to Test Investor Demand Before Confidence Vote

author: Sofia Horta e Costa, Henrique Almeida
description: The Portuguese government declared a national day of mourning after 15 people died in a tram derailment, one of Lisbon’s most tragic transport-related incidents.
title: Portugal Mourns After Deadliest Tram Crash in Lisbon’s History

author: John Liu, Fran Wang
description: A rare meeting of Chinese fiscal and monetary policymakers has prompted speculation among analysts that easing measures are on the cards that will bolster the bond market and economic growth this year.
title: Rare Chinese Huddle on Policy Stokes Talk of Economy, Bond Boost

author: Suttinee Yuvejwattana
description: The Bank of Thailand’s outgoing Governor Sethaput Suthiwartnarueput urged moving away from specific inflation targeting, saying price trends will increasingly get upended by supply shocks that monetary policy won’t be well-suited to handle.
title: Thai Central Bank Chief Urges Shift From Rigid Inflation Target

author: Eduard Gismatullin
description: Global funds are dipping back into Thai stocks as political uncertainty eases with a new prime minister set to be nominated on Friday.
title: Foreigners Return to Thai Stocks as Political Turmoil Wanes

author: Katia Dmitrieva
description: Asia’s export hubs are showing surprisingly robust economic results a month after US “reciprocal tariffs” came into force, easing fears that prompted economists to cut growth projections and regional central banks to warn of downside risks.
title: Asia Export Hubs Show Activity Still Robust Even After Tariffs

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: In the middle of Thailand’s latest political crisis, conservative politician Anutin Charnvirakul chatted at a snazzy bar with the country’s second-richest man and shared a homemade lunch with a powerful former general. Pictures of both meetings splashed across social media.
title: Thai PM Frontrunner Gets Shot at Leadership After Six Years

author: Zoe Tillman, Robert Burnson
description: A Washington federal judge has barred the Trump administration from unilaterally cutting roughly $12 billion in US foreign assistance funding that Congress approved and is poised to expire at the end of this month.
title: Trump Foreign Aid Block Stopped Again as Billions Set to Expire

author: Heidi Taksdal Skjeseth, Ott Ummelas
description: Divestments related to the Israel-Hamas war have brought charges of politicization — and warnings from the Trump camp.
title: Norway’s $2 Trillion Wealth Fund Has Become an Election Football

author: Natasha Voase
description: Some of China’s biggest ecommerce and logistics companies such as JD.com Inc. are making a beeline to Europe’s warehouses once again, as US President Donald Trump’s tariffs reshape manufacturers’ supply chains and markets.
title: Chinese Ecommerce Giants Rush to Europe as Trump Upends Trade

author: Samy Adghirni
description: France’s Socialists will sit down with Prime Minister Francois Bayrou on Thursday as part of his last-ditch effort to save his job.
title: French Socialists to Meet Premier With One Goal: Replacing Him

author: Daryna Krasnolutska, Alberto Nardelli, Samy Adghirni
description: European leaders are increasingly concerned that Russia will mount a new offensive on Ukraine as they sit down with president Volodymyr Zelenskiy to discuss security guarantees for his country.
title: Zelenskiy’s Allies Fear Putin Is Readying New Assault in Ukraine

author: Greg Stohr, Zoe Tillman
description: President Donald Trump asked the US Supreme Court to uphold his global tariffs, seeking review in a case that could affect trillions of dollars in trade and give him broad new leverage over the world economy.
title: Trump Asks US Supreme Court to Uphold His Global Tariffs

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japan’s top trade negotiator Ryosei Akazawa left for the US for ministerial talks, after lower-level discussions on the July trade deal largely wrapped up — an indication that the two sides are making progress on implementing the agreement.
title: Japan’s Akazawa Heads to US After Progress on Staff-Level Talks

author: Gerry Doyle
description: China revealed the scope of its nuclear weapon ambitions to the world this week when it rolled two new gigantic intercontinental ballistic missile designs through the streets of Beijing during the World War II anniversary parade.
title: China Shows Off Nuclear Ambitions With Expanding Missile Arsenal

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: A Trump pollster briefed Republican congressional staff on Wednesday about polling that showed broad support for childhood vaccines even among voters who supported the president, according to people familiar with the discussions.
title: Trump Pollster Briefed Republicans on Support for Vaccines

author: Valentina Fuentes, Matthew Malinowski
description: Chile’s top presidential campaigns vowed to navigate the trade rivalry between the US and China with a cool head and deepen ties with both nations, just as talks on tariffs imposed by Donald Trump near an end.
title: Chile Presidential Teams Press for Calm as Tariff Talks Near End

author: Denis Chabrol
description: Guyanese President Irfaan Ali has declared victory in the country’s general election, though the final count isn’t expected until Thursday. The incumbent says he is basing his claim off of district declarations so far.
title: Guyana President Ali Says He’s Won Enough Votes for Reelection

author: Erik Larson
description: President Donald Trump’s use of a 227-year-old wartime law to deport accused Venezuelan gang members to an El Salvador mega-prison without legal due process triggered lawsuits across the US. The Alien Enemies Act of 1798 allows a president to unilaterally detain or deport almost all citizens of an enemy nation during a war or invasion. Asserting the law in peacetime, as Trump did in a March proclamation, is unprecedented and tests the boundaries of executive power.
title: Why Courts Blocked Trump’s Use of Alien Enemies Act to Deport Venezuelans

author: Stephan Kueffner
description: Explosive testimony revealed by a prosecutor in Ecuador alleges that former President Rafael Correa ordered the two-year-old assassination of a presidential candidate who had for years criticized him as corrupt.
title: Ecuador Prosecutor Cites Witness Alleging Rafael Correa Ordered Villavicencio Assassination
